abstract: North Carolina Gov Pat McCrory, in rebuke of his own Republican Party and lawmakers, vows to veto measure that would allow some public officials to refuse to perform marriage ceremonies for religious reasons; move amounts to strong defense of gay marriage in state.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Pat McCrory, a Republican, pledged to reject a measure that would allow judges to refuse to perform marriage ceremonies because of their faith.

headline.main: North Carolina Governor Vows to Veto a Bill Seen as Targeting Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: A Vow to Veto a Bill Seen as Targeting Gay Marriage

snippet: Gov. Pat McCrory, a Republican, pledged to reject a measure that would allow judges to refuse to perform marriage ceremonies because of their faith.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
